JobFullDesc: Join us as we grow Designer, an AI-powered design service that’s helped billions of designs in PowerPoint and other products across the Microsoft ecosystem. As we grow the capabilities and scale of Designer, we need a talented product manager to join us on this journey and help us shape the future of this service loved by tens of millions of our customers. We are pushing the limits of machine learning to help create the world’s best presentations and designs and leveraging the best of our AI research to continue delighting our customers.  We need you to help us stay at the forefront of design and leverage AI and ML to help our customers achieve more and love doing it. We need someone who is willing to tackle a variety of problems with precision and tenacity and demonstrate versatility to tackle different types of user experience, interaction, and technical scenarios with good creativity and insight. ResponsibilitiesExpressing functional concepts and designs through storyboards, illustrations, and prototypes  Closely collaborating across disciplines to evaluate and iterate on ideas and designsManaging multiple projects, prioritizing, planning deliverables  Ability to ramp up and master relevant technical domain for your areas of ownership  Provide thought leadership and project leadership to engineers in your areas, formulate project and design goals, deeply understand user needs, and drive creative and compelling solutions to conclusion.  Qualifications2+ years of Product/Program Management experience on an end-user facing product with a design focus or AI-focus Skilled at creating efficient, desirable user experiences and technical designs  Ability to deeply understand user needs, workflows, and attitudes across a diverse customer setAbility to learn and master the technological underpinnings to the new functionality you are designing  Ability to work with various data sets and tools to analyze and understand features and user behaviors  Familiarity with data analysis tools  Familiarity with multiple platforms and capabilities   Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
